intro: Capsella pauciflora, commonly known as the lesser weed or mouse-ear. It is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia, characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with similar floral structures. Capsella pauciflora is an annual herb that completes its life cycle within one growing season.
